fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article about Lord Justice Leveson's inquiry into the culture, practices and ethics of Britain's press in the wake of the phone-hacking scandal incorrectly stated that "he would not at this stage be asking editors or proprietors to provide files" on which they had based stories about inappropriate press behaviour. In fact he said that he would not use his powers to compel editors: "... at this stage, I would rather invite editors, proprietors of magazines and journalists to assist me by providing a wide range of examples of what is contended to be inappropriate for one reason or another across the fullest range of titles" (Inquiry may not conclude until 2015 election, 29 July, page 4, early editions). • In a piece headlined Cinema of sin (1 August, page 20, G2) the original Scala picturehouse was sited on "Charlotte Street in north London". That should have been Tottenham Street, a small road in central London. • Homophone corner, albeit with regret: "Surely all politicians have an eye on the top of the greasy poll?" ('Labour are in total denial about the mess they created', 1 August, page 6, G2).
